markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mace](/Weapons.aspx?ID=362)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Shove" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=193" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 277 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Asmodeus](/Deities.aspx?ID=278), [Bolka](/Deities.aspx?ID=445), [Dispater](/Deities.aspx?ID=397), [Nurgal](/Deities.aspx?ID=433), [Orcus](/Deities.aspx?ID=241), [Otolmens](/Deities.aspx?ID=145), [Qi Zhong](/Deities.aspx?ID=314), [Ragdya](/Deities.aspx?ID=618), [Razmir](/Deities.aspx?ID=357), [Rivethun](/Deities.aspx?ID=388), [Winlas](/Deities.aspx?ID=656)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 gp

**Damage** 1d6 B

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5)
</row>

</column>

---

With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-5" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Black Scorpion Stingmace](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3202), [Chaplain's Cudgel](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2864)
name: Mace
